reviewText:
This was the first of two reviews I did on Livestream yesterday, nearly a week from the time it was supposed to be released.

In the twenty-four hours since that stream went live, both this game and Krog Wars went live on Steam, and now I can do an official review. I've spent a few minutes with the Steam version, and I've found this one somewhat improved from the version we used on the Stream.

They corrected exactly one bug, that being the one where the Game Over screen requires that you shut down the game and restart it before you can play again. This had the expected side effect of correcting the High Score saves, which isn't a bad thing. So, they get that much credit.

For those of you who have played Hovering Heli Death, this game will look somewhat familiar-- That's because it is. It's a direct asset swap with the other game, including the project name in the title bar in Windowed Mode. The game itself is horribly optimized, with Fastest graphics being almost unplayably fast, and the Best setting being almost the opposite.

A video record of the stream in its entirety can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h_CCsNv9NUM

Again, this game's pre-release review has been shifted to the General Discussions" forum
date: which is NOT visible if you don't already own the game. This IS a form of censorship
recommended: and I have zero issues calling it out.\n\nFortunately

reviewText:
Where to Begin.

Well my first reaction is featured here: https://youtu.be/Uqd1avAS7YE    Albeit it heavily edited. (Dont worry though, I kept the burps in)

But those of you not wanting to hear my nasally voice :

1)First and foremost I feel like this was falsely advertised, I not once encountered asteroids or enemy ships

2) This game is ugly, the lighting, the atmospher is non existent and even the space ship looks more like a shuttle at best.

3) This game performs like utter s*** I tested on both a windows 8 laptop and a windows 8 virtual machine, both had access to dual core intels with 8GB of ram and a competent graphics card, (note that this 2d abysmal space shooter shouldnt require more than at best 2GB) It ran poorly at all times.

4) The screen is limited to X number of bullets. This means that if you hold the mouse button you will blast too many bullets and the furthest ones just disappear.

5) The blue enemy bullets dont seem to make it accross the screen, the go from right to left and make it maybe 20% of the way before vanishing.

6) The red enemy bullets make it approx 80% of the way, this means that in most cases I could avoid damage by simply positioning the ship at the furthest position left.

7) Your first run starts you with 3 lives + your starting life (total of 4) but any run additional starts you with just 2 for some reason.

8) There is a highscore board with no highcores and seemingly no way to post your score.

9) If you die, it goes all the way back to the beginning, and i have to sit through your digital homicide splash screen each time.

10) When you die, the screen goes black and you have an explosion animation - You guys cant even script it so the ship itself exploads, it has to load up a cutscene to represent the ship exploading.

11) You respawn exactly where you died meaning the enemies can land some cheap shots.

12) Your stupid F***ing Unity pregame screen. Sid Alpha has pointed this out on all of his reviews of your games, and noted your overall laziness with it. This is a new low however as  IT SAYS HOVERING HELIDEATH IS THE TITLE

13) Lets talk about titles. The store front calls it Starship Alpha strike, the unity pregame menu calls it hovering helideath and the titlescreen calls is NOTHING Are you guys really  This  lazy?

14) The controls are very stiff and static. Meaning that there is no acceleration, you push WASD to move at a steady speed in the given direction.

15) You're charging money for this.

16) Your Lasers arent lasers, theyre some generic 'fairy dust' effect you got from the unity store.

17) Speaking of lasers, they dont fire from the correct position if you are moving upward they fire from the bottom of your ship, if you are moving downward they fire from the top. When your engine adds the laser object it doesnt take into account ship movement which is below amateurish

18) Speaking of lasers - Do you know what makes these types of games fun? Power ups!
It is such a common mechanic to have stacking power ups - Faster firing rates, Spread shots, Wave Shots, Back lasers, Arching lasers, Homing missiles, Multi blasts, charge shots,  Freezing shot... Of course this game has nothing to it so my guess is that power ups wouldnt add that much


19) its only 1 f***ing level - Call this a runner if you want, to me that just shows how pretentious and slimey you are capable of being. It's not under developed, its a runner! Give me a break. The sad thing is that Newgrounds and Kong feature hundreds of similar games that are better in every regard. FOR FREE


....Unbelievable...

reviewText:
Like my Krog Wars review,I'm going to avoid insulting Digital Homicide directly as I'm not here to review a company in general and I condemn harassment.

Here's the stream that I did live with Kage where we covered the itch.io versions of Starship: Nova Strike and Krog Wars.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h_CCsNv9NUM

Me and Kage believe tht Digital Homicide watched our stream so we were expecting that they were to improve on some of the issues we covered in both of these games before their release. When I covered Krog Wars, I learnt that they had not made any sort of improvement. However, Starship is a slightly different story.

If you've read Kage's review of this, you know that they fixed 2 issues in this game that we covered in the stream. The first issue was the fact that once you hit the game over screen, you hd to restart the game as you were stuck on that screen. The second issue was that the high score board at the beginning also didn't work as a result of the game needing a restart. Now here's something that I was surprised that Kage missed in the Steam version. When they fixed these issues, a few new issues came up. Even though they've fixed the issue to make the high scores appear (which they didn't in the itch.io version), they messed up the coding to stop adding on from ur previous high score. In other words, whatever score you got on the previous round, it keeps that score for the next match as yur starting score. In the itch.io version you had 3 lives. In the Steam version, you still technically have 3 lives but it's actually 2. Basically when I fired up the Steam version of the game, I was faced with a black screen for maybe 5 seconds and it said tht I died and I lost a life and this happened each time the game launched up. Some of the missiles also randomly dissappeared in the middle of the screen. In addition to all of this, I experienced alot of lag when I was shooting missiles, making the game drop to 30 and sometimes even 20 fps.

This game is a waste of money and that's the only thing I can call it. For the deal of 47p it's a waste of money. For 1p, it will be a waste of money. Only consider picking this up if it's free and then consider to change your mind.

My curator group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/MellowReviews

Do yourself a favor, and spend your 1$/â‚¬ for something else. Probably on something you'd enjoy.

reviewText:
Unoptimised, barelly playable mess.

1. There are 7 types of the enemies. 4 of them are asteroids from Asteroid Pack 01 by Dark Anvil (5,5 Euro on Unity Asset Store).
2. I have less fps in 1366x768 than in Dark Souls, Borderlands the Pre-Sequel, L.A. Noire or Alan Wake - and none of thease games are propelly optimised, but all ot them looks better. 60 fps in Lords of the Fallen? No problem. 15 fps here? Usually... It is probably the fault of participle systems. Replacing those with texture based animation could make all the difference in the world.
3. Fire rate seams to be frame rate independant, movement speed seams to be frame rate dependant. Compared with point 2 guess how it works out.
4. Some enemies and enemy projectiles dissapear in mid screen. Probably their timer runs out, because it only happens in low frame rates.
5. There is only one level.
6. In low res it looks much worse than 1994 Raptor Call of The Shadow. It plays much worse too.
7. The only music track is about 7 seconds long. There are also 5 more sound effects. And that's entire sound.
8. Seriously, I've seen more polished tutorial games. And it was 10 years ago, and they were made in flash.
9. On Unity Asset Store you can find almost identical energy shield and space ships for less than 10 Euros each. It looks like this game is about 20-30 Euros worth of assets and 2-4 hours long tutorial. Really? I mean there is nothing wrong with using pre-existing assets, but it is not enough for whole game.

reviewText:
According to all known laws
of aviation,


there is no way a bee
should be able to fly.


Its wings are too small to get
its fat little body off the ground.


The bee, of course, flies anyway


because bees don't care
what humans think is impossible.


Yellow, black. Yellow, black.
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.


Ooh, black and yellow!
Let's shake it up a little.


Barry! Breakfast is ready!


Ooming!


Hang on a second.


Hello?


- Barry?
- Adam?


- Oan you believe this is happening?
- I can't. I'll pick you up.


Looking sharp.


Use the stairs. Your father
paid good money for those.


Sorry. I'm excited.


Here's the graduate.
We're very proud of you, son.


A perfect report card, all B's.


Very proud.


Ma! I got a thing going here.


- You got lint on your fuzz.
- Ow! That's me!


- Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.
- Bye!


Barry, I told you,
stop flying in the house!


- Hey, Adam.
- Hey, Barry.


- Is that fuzz gel?
- A little. Special day, graduation.


Never thought I'd make it.


Three days grade school,
three days high school.


Those were awkward.


Three days college. I'm glad I took
a day and hitchhiked around the hive.


You did come back different.


- Hi, Barry.
- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good.


- Hear about Frankie?
- Yeah.


- You going to the funeral?
- No, I'm not going.


Everybody knows,
sting someone, you die.


Don't waste it on a squirrel.
Such a hothead.


I guess he could have
just gotten out of the way.


I love this incorporating
an amusement park into our day.


That's why we don't need vacations.


Boy, quite a bit of pomp...
under the circumstances.


- Well, Adam, today we are men.
- We are!


- Bee-men.
- Amen!


Hallelujah!


Students, faculty, distinguished bees,


please welcome Dean Buzzwell.


Welcome, New Hive Oity
graduating class of...


...9:15.


That concludes our ceremonies.


And begins your career
at Honex Industries!


Will we pick ourjob today?


I heard it's just orientation.


Heads up! Here we go.


Keep your hands and antennas
inside the tram at all times.


- Wonder what it'll be like?
- A little scary.


Welcome to Honex,
a division of Honesco


and a part of the Hexagon Group.


This is it!


Wow.


Wow.


We know that you, as a bee,
have worked your whole life


to get to the point where you
can work for your whole life.


Honey begins when our valiant Pollen
Jocks bring the nectar to the hive.


Our top-secret formula


is automatically color-corrected,
scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured


into this soothing sweet syrup


with its distinctive
golden glow you know as...


Honey!


- That girl was hot.
- She's my cousin!


- She is?
- Yes, we're all cousins.


- Right. You're right.
- At Honex, we constantly strive


to improve every aspect
of bee existence.


These bees are stress-testing
a new helmet technology.


- What do you think he makes?
- Not enough.


Here we have our latest advancement,
the Krelman.


- What does that do?
- Oatches that little strand of honey


that hangs after you pour it.
Saves us millions.


Oan anyone work on the Krelman?


Of course. Most bee jobs are
small ones. But bees know


that every small job,
if it's done well, means a lot.


But choose carefully


because you'll stay in the job
you pick for the rest of your life.


The same job the rest of your life?
I didn't know that.


What's the difference?


You'll be happy to know that bees,
as a species, haven't had one day off


in 27 million years.


So you'll just work us to death?


We'll sure try.


Wow! That blew my mind!


What's the difference?"
How can you say that?


One job forever?
That's an insane choice to have to make.


I'm relieved. Now we only have
to make one decision in life.


But
